longcomment.line_1: Provides methods for obtaining performance statistics for the host computer or an individual virtual machine. To obtain the L{Statistics} object for the host computer, use the L{Server.get_statistics} method. To obtain the L{Statistics} object for a virtual machine, use the L{Vm.get_statistics} method.
Contains info about access rights that the users other than the owner have in respect to the virtual machine.
Provides common Parallels Python API system methods.
Provides methods for managing boot device in a virtual machine. An object contains information about an
longcomment.line_2: individual boot device.

longcomment.line_1: Provides common Parallels Python API debug methods.
Provides methods for creating, configuring, and maintaining Parallels virtual disks.
Provides methods for managing Parallels Service preferences.
Contains information about a system event or an extended error information in
longcomment.line_2: an asynchronous method invocation.

longcomment.line_1: Contains the system event parameter data.
Contains summary information about a virtual machine that was found as a result of a virtual machine search
longcomment.line_2: operation.

longcomment.line_1: Contains information about a file system entry (disk, directory, file) on the host computer.
Contains information about a file system entry and its immediate
longcomment.line_2: child elements (files and directories) on the host computer.

longcomment.line_1: The Handle class is the ancestor of all classes that are equivalents of handles
longcomment.line_2: in the C API on which this API is based. Handles provide the most functionality in the API.

longcomment.line_1: A generic container containing a list of handles (objects).
Provides methods for obtaining information about a physical hard disk partition on the host computer.
A base class providing methods for obtaining information about physical devices on the host computer.
longcomment.line_2: The descendants of this class provide additional methods specific to a particular device type.

longcomment.line_1: Provides methods for obtaining information about a physical hard disk on the host computer.
Provides methods for obtaining information about a physical network adapter on the host computer.
Provides methods for obtaining information about a PCI device on the host computer.
Provides methods for managing asynchronous operations (jobs).
Provides methods for obtaining the Parallels license information.
Contains information returned as a result of a successful Parallels Service login operation.
Provides methods for obtaining the Parallels Service network status information.
Provides access to the Port Forwarding functionality.
longcomment.line_2: Using this functionality, you can redirect all incoming data from a specific TCP port on the host
longcomment.line_3: computer to a specified port in a specified virtual machine.

longcomment.line_1: Contains the results of an asynchronous operation.
The RunningTask class is used to recover from a lost Parallels Service connection.
longcomment.line_2: It allows to attach to an existing task that was started in the previous session and
longcomment.line_3: is still running inside the Parallels Service.

longcomment.line_1: The class provides methods for modify the list of screen resolutions available in a virtual machine.
longcomment.line_2: By default, only the most common resolutions are supported in a virtual machine.
longcomment.line_3: Using methods of this class, you can add additional resolutions and modify the existing ones if needed.

longcomment.line_1: The main class providing methods for accessing Parallels Service.
longcomment.line_2: Most of the operations in the Parallels Python API begin with obtaining an instance of this class.
longcomment.line_3: The class is used to establish a connection with the Parallels Service. Its other methods can be used
longcomment.line_4: to perform various tasks related to the Parallels Service itself, higher level virtual machine tasks,
longcomment.line_5: such as obtaining the virtual machine list or creating a virtual machine, and many others.

longcomment.line_1: Provides methods for obtaining the host computer configuration information.
Provides methods for obtaining the Parallels Service information.
Provides methods for managing host shares.
longcomment.line_2: Using this class, you can make a host OS directory visible and accessible in a virtual machine.

longcomment.line_1: Provides methods for retrieving information from the Tools Information Service database.
Provides methods for obtaining information about the currently logged in user and
longcomment.line_2: for setting the user preferences.

longcomment.line_1: Provides methods for obtaining information about the specified Parallels Service user.
Provides methods for managing Parallels virtual networks.
The Vm class provides methods for managing virtual machines.
longcomment.line_2: When you want to get the information about, modify, or create a
longcomment.line_3: virtual machine, you have to obtain an instance of this class.
longcomment.line_4: The instance is obtained using methods of other classes. The
longcomment.line_5: most commonly used methods are L{Server.create_vm}

longcomment.line_1: Provides methods for managing the configuration of a virtual machine.
A base class providing methods for virtual device management.
The VmGuest class is used to run programs and execute administrative tasks in a virtual machine.
Provides methods for managing virtual hard disks in a virtual machine.
Provides methods for managing partitions of a virtual hard disk in a virtual machine.
Contains the virtual machine state, access rights, and some other information.
Provides methods for sending keyboard commands to a virtual machine.
Provides methods for managing network adapters in a virtual machine.
Provides methods for managing serial ports in a virtual machine.
Provides methods for managing sound devices in a virtual machine.
Provides methods for determining whether the Parallels Tools package is installed in a virtual
longcomment.line_2: machine and for obtaining its status and version information.

longcomment.line_1: Provides methods for managing USB devices in a virtual machine.

symbol.name: PrlAcl_GetAccessForOthers
symbol.shortcomment: Obtain the virtual machine access rights information.

longcomment.line_1: @return: One of the following access rights constants:
longcomment.line_2: PAO_VM_NOT_SHARED - only the owner of the virtual machine has access to it.
longcomment.line_3: PAO_VM_SHARED_ON_VIEW - other users can view but not run the virtual machine.
longcomment.line_4: PAO_VM_SHARED_ON_VIEW_AND_RUN - other useres can view and run the vitual machine.
longcomment.line_5: PAO_VM_SHARED_ON_FULL_ACCESS - all users have full access to a virtual machine.

symbol.name: PrlAcl_GetOwnerName
symbol.shortcomment: Determine the virtual machine owner name.

longcomment.line_1: @return: A string containing the owner name.

symbol.name: PrlAcl_IsAllowed
symbol.shortcomment: Determine if the current user is authorized to perform a specified task on the virtual machine.

longcomment.line_1: @param nPermission: The task type. Can be one of constants with the PAR_ prefix, such as:
longcomment.line_2: PAR_VM_START_ACCESS, PAR_VM_STOP_ACCESS, PAR_VM_PAUSE_ACCESS, PAR_VM_RESET_ACCESS, PAR_VM_SUSPEND_ACCESS, PAR_VM_RESUME_ACCESS, PAR_VM_DELETE_ACCESS, and others.
longcomment.line_3: @return: A Boolean value indicating whether the user is authorized to perform the task.

symbol.name: PrlAcl_IsCurrentSessionOwner
symbol.shortcomment: Determine if the current user is the owner of the virtual machine.

longcomment.line_1: @return: A Boolean value. True - the current user is the owner. False - the user is not the owner.

symbol.name: PrlAcl_SetAccessForOthers
symbol.shortcomment: Set access rights on a virtual machine.

longcomment.line_1: @param nAccessForOthers: The access rights level to set. Can be one of the following constants:
longcomment.line_2: PAO_VM_NOT_SHARED - only the owner of the virtual machine has access to it.
longcomment.line_3: PAO_VM_SHARED_ON_VIEW - other users can view the virtual machine.
longcomment.line_4: PAO_VM_SHARED_ON_VIEW_AND_RUN - other users can view and run the virtual machine.
longcomment.line_5: PAO_VM_SHARED_ON_FULL_ACCESS - all users have full access to the virtual machine.

symbol.name: PrlStat_GetCpusStatsCount
symbol.shortcomment: Return the number of L{StatCpu} objects contained in this L{Statistics} object. Each L{StatCpu} object contains statistics for an individual CPU.

longcomment.line_1: Use the number returned to iterate through the object list and obtain individual objects using the L{Statistics.get_cpu_stat} method.
longcomment.line_2: @return: Integer. The number of L{StatCpu} objects contained in this L{Statistics} object.

symbol.name: PrlStat_GetDisksStatsCount
symbol.shortcomment: Return the number of L{StatDisk} objects contained in this L{Statistics} object. Each L{StatDisk} object contains statistics for an individual hard disk.

longcomment.line_1: Use the number returned to iterate through the object list and obtain individual objects using the L{Statistics.get_disk_stat} method.
